text:
Hello team, we had a very unfortunate event tonight. My next door neighbor had a big fire break out in her household and we spent quite some time with her outside so she is not out there by herself during this event. So I will be coming into office a bit later tomorrow as it is now the middle of the night…

My status: I have incorporated all the changes Bret and I have made for the Orderer class and the associated unit tests. I made sure all the tests are running to my satisfaction. I have opened the PR here and it’s ready for review: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1681/1>

Bret, I’ll try to be in around 10 and we can begin debugging your connection issue from the Member class. The plan is to make progress on that code, add any remaining tests, and open another PR with Bret on that on Wednesday. 

Thanks!
<@U0Z81GL6S> wow i hope everybody is ok! thanks for thinking of putting up the status while in the middle of the incident
google hangout for today’s scrums (in 4min at 9:30am ET): <https://hangouts.google.com/hangouts/_/bqyxlr6u25epjpn4iayws5kksue>

Status = I completed a UT coverage matrix for event-tests.   Of 15 methods in class eventHub, five are covered.  It looks like two calls are not meant to be invoked by clients, so that leaves 13 methods not tested.  Today I will try to learn why so many methods have no UT coverage.

got all fixes in for FAB-392 (TLS) and  FAB-595 (integrate UT to 0.6). I have a commit sitting in my local repo that has all of the code from both change 1655 and 1607. However, waiting for updates from Ash to address review comments. Will push when he is done.
Working today on FabricFAB-585 for the CI-enablement of fabric-sdk-node unit tests

Status: 
Created new change 1707 to add a trailing spaces check to gulp lint.   It's ready for review.
Worked on FAB-659.  
Change 1661 needs to be verified/merged.
